Ga jij door tot de data puzzel klopt?
 Als Data Engineer (SQL) werk je vanuit ons kantoor in Ede aan het data gedeelte van systemen voor onze klanten. Samen met je collega consultants ga je data verzamelen uit verschillende bronsystemen. Met door jou gebouwde query’s zorg jij ervoor dat de verzamelde data in onze oplossingen en door jou gebouwde dashboards komt. Je krijgt ruime opleidingsmogelijkheden. Je komt te werken in een platte organisatie met klein team en een fijne werksfeer. Je zoekt een baan waar je binnen ‘no time’ veel kennis vergaart. Je werkt vanuit ons ruime en goed- met de auto of ov- bereikbare kantoor in Ede.

 Jouw Baan
 Je werkt aan use cases voor onze klanten. Je gaat eerst de specifieke databronnen analyseren. Vervolgens ga je query’s coderen, je datamodel testen en debuggen. Je gaat datasources combineren, updaten en onderhouden. Je zorgt ervoor dat de verzamelde data in onze oplossingen komt en wordt ontsloten in door jou gebouwde dashboards. De functie is intern binnen Puur Data en je werkt voor onze klanten. Je werkt samen met andere consultants en developers
  Gegevens analyseren, modelleren en interpreteren
 Problemen oplossen op een methodische en logische manier.
 Programmeren / Scripting SQL Werk inplannen en deadlines halen
 Communiceren met klanten

 HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau 
 Sterke analytische en conceptuele vaardigheden
 Je hebt enige ervaring met het programmeren in SQL.
 Goede beheersing van Nederlands en Engels

 Competenties: Analytisch denkvermogen, nauwkeurig werken, goede communicatieve vaardigheden, kunnen werken onder tijdsdruk.

 Marktconform salaris afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en opleiding

Interesse?

Introduction

 The Volvo Group is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of trucks, buses, construction equipment and marine and industrial engines under the leading brands Volvo, Renault Trucks, Mack, UD Trucks, Eicher, SDLG, Terex Trucks, Prevost, Nova Bus, UD Bus, Sunwin Bus and Volvo Penta.
    Volvo Group IT manages the Group’s overall IT strategies and plans and has the end-to-end responsibility for all development, delivery, support of IT solution and services for the Volvo Group.
    We are more than 6000 people based in 36 countries working in a completely global organization. We are a team of highly skilled professionals who work with passion, trust each other and embrace change to stay ahead. We make our customers win.
   

This is us your colleagues

 Working for Volvo Group IT Center of Excellence means breaking new grounds, investigating and exploring ways of working and new techniques.
    With us, you have the possibility to specialize within a certain area of interest and you will be an important contributor in making the Volvo Group succeed, meaning you will work and co-operate with stakeholders and peers all over the Volvo Group.
    We are already at the forefront when it comes to technology and building future mobility solutions, and we believe having engaged employees is the key to our success. We value flexibility and work life balance, and in return we ask for your commitment in order to make this happen.
   

Do you just love to … 

 We support the Volvo Group Mission of driving prosperity through transport solutions. At the Center of Excellence we aim to contribute to the mission by delivering digital expertise, emerging technology know-how, and best practice and methods. We continually strive to be the trusted partner in the digital transformation of the Volvo Group.
   
 The Center of Excellence is a unit at Group IT - a large multi-cultural organization with 800+ employees and 150+ contractors located mainly in 7 countries - Sweden, Poland, India, France, US, Brazil, USA, and Belgium.
   

Role description

 Work and experiment with state-of-the-art data storage and processing technologies
 Build large-scale batch and real-time data pipelines with data processing frameworks such as Spark in cloud platforms (mainly MS Azure) or on premise
 Create and manage environments for advanced analytics/machine/deep learning and AI
 Leverage best practices in continuous integration and delivery
 Pre-process, clean and structure data to facilitate data exploration and advanced analytics/Machine Learning activities
 Learning and using modern data preparation, integration and AI-enabled metadata management tools and techniques
 Tracking data consumption patterns, working with data governance and information stewards within these teams, and participate in vetting and promoting content created in the business and by data scientists to the curated data catalog for governed reuse
 Performing intelligent sampling and caching
 Recommending and automating — existing and future integration flows
 Help improving data quality by driving advancements in data acquisition, testing and tooling
 Work in cross functional agile teams to continuously experiment, iterate and deliver on new product objectives
 Collaborate with other Data Engineers, Data Scientists and business stakeholders to increase the long-term quality of delivery and learning


Are you the one?

 You know how to work with high volume heterogeneous data, preferably with distributed open-source frameworks such as Hadoop, as well as commercial data management platforms
 You have experience in writing scripts with Python and Spark preparation/cleaning, as well as network architecture and collaborative work (git, etc.)
 You have proven experience in the role of data-engineer in the MS Azure Advanced Analytics stack
 You are knowledgeable in data storage techniques (SQL, noSQL, etc.), data structuring, data 


A perfect match?

 Imagine yourself working with the sharpest and most creative brains in the transport and infrastructure industry, developing cutting-edge technologies and sustainable transport solutions that will change the future of society.
    Imagine yourself working with IT in a company that really believes people are its driving force, fostering a culture of energy, passion and respect for the individual.
    Imagine yourself working for the Volvo Group, a global leader in sustainable transport solutions. A place where your voice is heard, where your ideas matter. Together we move the world.
    Will you join us?

About Poplar Homes


    Poplar Homes is a fast-growing Silicon Valley proptech company founded in 2014. The company is a tech-enabled property manager for residential homes and apartments. It provides full-service leasing and property management, from finding a home to fixing something when it breaks. With over 5,000 doors under management, Poplar is one of the top 50 largest property managers in the US and currently services 10 major metro markets across 5 states: CA, WA, NV, CO, and TX.

Responsibilities
 Your day to day: Coding, data, technology – that’s your world! Be part of our Digital Operations Teams and shape new and innovative solutions for the transformation of Vodafone towards the Digital Telco. As a member of the company Network Operations Data Science team your main focus will be to employ data science methods to analyze large data sets and implement your findings in professional software for real-time network problem detection and automated resolution. You will be involved in all parts of a project, starting from requirements engineering, solutions design, software development, and testing to deployment, thus taking ownership of your products. You work with state-of-the art development tools and open-source libraries to create software tailor made for automation requirements. Develop solutions together in an interdisciplinary team of data engineers, software developers and system specialists, and take over professional leadership functions in a team.


Requirements
 With these activities you will have a great impact on our business:
  Develop software in a dynamic team employing agile development processes and Python
  Employ statistical methods to correlate network parameters, network topology and customer experience data to identify network problems and solve them automatically and predictively  Evaluate large data sets with state-of-the-art data science methods like machine learning, classification, clustering, and pattern search  Design and implement algorithms to detect network and service problems in real-time  Implement your findings and take cross-functional responsibility introducing your work with pilot projects into production  Manage the whole life cycle of your solutions: from design towards implementation and maintenance (DevOps)  Be up to date in terms of current and future technologic trends  Share your expertise with your fellow teammates to grow as a team




Additional Information
 With these skills you are a great candidate:  Master’s in computer science, physics, mathematics, or communications engineering  Strong problem solving and solution-oriented thinking  Very Strong analytical capabilities, data science and statistics know-how  Strong programming skills and experience in software development, experience with Python  Fluent in English.


 Nice to have:  Knowledge of Agile methodologies and development tools  Know how in telecommunications networks

Your mission
 At LOGEX we turn data into better healthcare LOGEX delivers analytics solutions that enable data-driven decision making in every area of healthcare – from operations and finance to clinical and patient outcomes – in order to achieve the best possible value. The right people make this all possible. That’s why we’re constantly on the lookout for brilliant minds from a wide range of expertise. Our team of over 450 international experts consists of data scientists, analysts, consultants and experts in technology, healthcare economics, medicine, mathematics and statistics. We work together to support our customers and build long-term, mutually fulfilling partnerships with them. If you enjoy solving complex problems for the greater good and working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial culture, then LOGEX is the company for you.  The Team The Life Sciences team – currently consisting of 40 people – is growing enormously and is in full swing. The team is primarily responsible for gaining insights into the use and effect of (expensive) drugs. In view of the aging population, a significant increase in drug use and new drugs is expected – and a corresponding increase in costs. To keep these rising costs in check, it is essential to have a truly clear picture of the exact effect of medicines. The data and dashboards of the Life Sciences team offer a solution for this. The team has the mission to grow across Europe through European business development and sales activities.  What you will be doing as Data engineer in Life Science Team Without data management, there is no suitable data to work with. Within your work, you will design the data foundation of the Life Sciences analytics and products. Where does the data come from? How do we handle and store data? What are the different dataflows and how can they be streamlined? What reference data do we need in different markets or countries? Do we have the right procedures and systems in place to execute scalable analytics? Data Management is about finding, interpreting, structuring and processing data in such a way that we, as LOGEX, can help our clients making reliable fact-based decisions. As an Data engineer, you have experience in data analytics and ETL processes, are keen to learn more about the field as well as the application of data analytics and ‘big data’ in healthcare, and you want to have an impact on the healthcare institutions.  You will be working in a range of technical and analytical workflows, such as; data validation, data warehouse, ETL and data models, data analytics, product testing and development. You will also be expected to assume responsibility of whole or parts of workstreams. You will be working together with the analytics team, product owners within the company and a team of developers. The objective of the team is to plan, develop and maintain software products and analytics working environment in accordance with the business unit strategy and the overarching goal of creating positive impact on healthcare and patients. You will play an important role in assuring this accomplishment. You will be part of a young and ambitious team of associates, analysts and developers that share the mission of creating cutting-edge analytical software that help our customers gain actionable insights into the complexity of their data.
 Your profile
 What you bring to the table

 quantitative / technical educational background
 You have 2-4 years experience with data analytics of large datasets
 You have experience with the concepts of designing ETL processes (Python)
 You have experience and good knowledge of relational databases and data models and Datawarehouse (preferably SQL)
 You have a clear interest in working hands on with data management and algorithms to support the software development
 You like to structure data and realize scalable data processing structures
 You speak and write English fluently. Dutch is not required
 You have experience in the context of software product development; is a plus
 You have prior experience with a link to the health sector; is a plus


 People we love

 Real world and ‘big data’ issues in healthcare excite you
 Have a strong drive and want to have an impact on the business
 Have an analytical mindset and excellent problem solving skills
 Happy to take much responsibility in workstreams
 Feel at ease in an informal and professional setting where you get a lot of freedom and responsibility
 Result-driven and solution oriented, with a structured way of working and pragmatic flexible mentality


 Why us?
 What we offer

 A competitive compensation package, pension, internet- and phone allowance, Learning & Development via LOGEX academy, NS Business Card, hybrid work
 25 holidays (on a fulltime basis) to recharge your batteries
 A challenging role in a fast growing, international company
 An informal work environment with ambitious colleagues
 Laptop and home office supplies to create a comfortable and healthy work environment


 LOGEX’s Mission
 Healthcare today is more tailored and more effective than ever before. However, with these improvements, come greater complexity and costs. The burden of healthcare spending weighs heavily on economies and the sheer number of options physicians and patients can choose from leads to uncertainty and unacceptable variations in clinical outcomes.
  At LOGEX, we have one superpower: data analysis. We choose to use this superpower to help address today’s healthcare issues by turning data into better healthcare.
 

How we do it
 Data is at the core of the solutions we offer, but people are at the heart of everything we do. Our team of more than 450 international experts consists of data scientists, analysts, consultants, and experts in technology, healthcare economics, medicine, mathematics, and statistics. Together, we help stakeholders at more than 750 healthcare-providing institutions across Europe by bringing clarity to decisions that result in the best possible outcome at the lowest possible cost.
  LOGEX is serious about its 
 mission to turn data into better healthcare and we are growing fast. That’s why we’re constantly on the lookout for brilliant minds from a wide range of disciplines.
  If you enjoy solving complex problems for the greater good and working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial culture, then LOGEX is the company for you.

DASSAULT SYSTEMS 3DEXPERIENCE® Cloud is a new generation of product design and innovation tools. Focusing on SOLIDWORKS & CATIA technologies, the 3DEXPERIENCE® Cloud allows designers and engineers to work more freely and efficiently on their projects.

Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de Data Engineer para trabajar junto a nuestro cliente WOM quien ha revolucionado la industria de las telecomunicaciones en nuestro país.
 
 Misión del cargo:
 

Operar mecanismos para brindar la disponibilidad y calidad de los datos, combinando distintas fuentes de información para crear formatos consistentes listos para ser consumidos. Velando por la arquitectura de datos que habilitan la extracción y transformación, para modelos predictivos y prescriptivos, asegurando la continuidad operacional del datawarehouse mediante la resolución de incidentes. 

 Principales funciones:
 

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener el despliegue de pipelines ETL para reportería, análisis de datos, desarrollo de modelos Machine Learning, validación y despliegue de manera escalable (arquitectura de datos).
Administrar y configurar orquestadores de procesos ETL.
Asegurar la continuidad del datawarehouse en GCP y Netezza, resolviendo y analizando incidentes que afecten su funcionamiento.
Contribuir al diseño e implementación del Dawarehouse y Data Lake.
Planificar y entregar estrategias de integración de datos que sean seguras y basadas en buenas prácticas.
Trabajar con el equipo de Data Science, Analytics, Producto e Infraestructura para entender requerimientos de negocio y crear plataformas de datos acorde a las necesidades.

 Condiciones laborales:
 

Horario bajo artículo 22.
La posición requiere disponibilidad de poder cubrir "turno" de urgencia cuando sea requerido. En caso de realizarse se compensa con bono aparte de su remuneración.
Modalidad de trabajo: 100% remoto. Se puede flexibilizar a hibrido si el profesional lo requiere.
Modalidad contrato: Proyecto inicial por 3 meses con posibilidad de renovación a 6 meses.

 Requisitos:
 

Título profesional en carreras de Ingeniería Civil Electrónica, Ingeniería Civil, Ingeniería en Ejecución en Informática, Ingeniería estadística o carrera afín (excluyente).
Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en el cargo cumpliendo funciones descritas como Data Engineer, Ingeniero de Soporte BI o Analista BI Senior (excluyente).
Ideal experiencia en rubro de Telecomunicaciones, Banca o Retail.
Manejo de SQL y NoSQL (excluyente).
Manejo de Python, Java o Scala (excluyente).
Manejo de herramientas ETL.
Ideal conocimiento en Cloud computing (Google Cloud con preferencia luego AWS, Azure, etc).
Deseable experiencia con frameworks de ML.
Conocimientos en CI/CD.
Deseable certificación en Data Engineering (AWS, GCP).
Entendimiento de múltiples tecnologías (Spark, Hadoop, EMR), Sistemas RDBMS (MS SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL), Servicios de Bases de Datos Cloud (DynamoDB, Elasticache for Redis, Snowflake).

 Beneficios:
 

Beneficios de caja compensación los Andes.
Beneficios de Achs.
Descuentos en centros de Salud, centros dentales, centros oftalmológicos y librerías, entre otros.
Convenios con centros estéticos, centros vacacionales, cursos de ingles, entre otros.

Company information:
 LeoVegas’ passion is “Greatest Gaming Experience”. LeoVegas is Sweden’s premier GameTech company and is at the forefront of using state-of-the-art technology for mobile gaming.
 A large part of this success can be credited to an extreme product and technology focus coupled with effective and data-driven marketing. Technology development is conducted in Sweden, while operations are based in Malta.
 LeoVegas offers casino, live casino and sports betting. We operate global and scalable brands including LeoVegas & Royal Panda, as well as several UK facing brands such as Pink Casino & Bet UK.
 At LeoVegas, data is essential to all our decision making needs regarding customer behavior, marketing, social media, product development and discovery of new markets.
 The Data Engineering Team is responsible for gathering and processing this information into consumable insights using Big Data technologies.
 As our Data Engineer you will join a team of four data engineers and two data quality engineers that works with the latest technologies available inside the Google GCP ecosystem.
 You will be responsible for elaborating new solutions, implementing and maintaining batch, near real-time and real time ETL pipelines having quality, performance and costs optimization in mind.
 Our pillars:

 Dataflow
 BigQuery
 Airflow

 Our language mix:

 Java
 Python
 SQL

 We are constantly experimenting and PoC-ing in order to bring our Data Warehouse to the next level.
 At LeoVegas Mobile Gaming Group we firmly believe that our diversity is what makes us unique and that everyone and anyone is welcome to enjoy the ride - regardless of age, gender, disability, race, national or ethnic origin, religion, language, marital or civil partnership status, political beliefs and sexual orientation.
 We are highly committed to uphold a high level of diversity and inclusion throughout our entire group. Being a global company with a widely diverse customer base makes it essential for our workforce to be a reflection of this.
 By doing so, we believe we will achieve the best possible customer experience and create better value to our shareholders by doing so.  Working Hours:
 We are currently working 1-2 days from the office and rest is work from home.
 Compensation & Benefits:

 Competitive basic salary
 Life - Occupational injuries & sickness insurance
 Possibility to enroll in an attractive private health care insurance for both you and your partner
 3,000 SEK wellness contribution p/a
 30 annual vacation days
 1,500 SEK tech allowance
 Occupational Pension - Details on request
 Benify - A benefits portal with lots of attractive discounts
 Parental pay when you have worked for us 1 year+
 Plenty of great company events!
 Mobile Phone & Laptop
 If you are not based in the job location, we will also provide you with a relocation package including flights and 2 months accommodation.

Strategie, data en intelligence. Die drie kunnen volgens jou niet zonder elkaar. Als Data Engineer bij TeamValue werk je zowel op strategisch, tactisch en operationeel niveau aan oplossingen voor bijvoorbeeld Air Miles, Humanitas, Lifetri en Deftpower. Ga jij helemaal aan op de back-end van BI? Mooi! Wij ook.
Wat ga je doen als Data Engineer?
Als Data Engineer bouw je mee aan en denk je mee over Modern Data Warehouses, data lakes, Machine Learning toepassingen en Data Analyses en rapportages die futureproof zijn. Je werkt in een multidisciplinair team van BI’ers, Azure Cloud Specialisten, Scrum Masters en Agile Coaches. Het Microsoft platform kun je wel dromen inmiddels en je doet er alles aan om up-to-date te blijven over de nieuwste releases. SQL, Python, Power BI, Synapse Analytics en de Azure Data Factory ken je op je duimpje. Jij voelt je helemaal thuis in de wereld van BI & Analytics.
Meer weten over de projecten waar wij aan werken? Neem hier een kijkje. Onze collega’s kunnen niet wachten je te ontmoeten. Xander zal persoonlijk koffie voor je zetten.
Wie ben jij?
Een echte data gek. Maar dan wel iemand die het ook tof vindt om betrokken te zijn bij het dataproces van A tot Z. Je analyseert niet alleen, maar modelleert en bouwt ook mee. Je zet architecturen op waar organisaties hun bedrijfskritische applicaties nog jaren mee vooruit kunnen.
Jij hebt lef! Je durft kritisch te zijn tegen onze klanten. Je helpt de klant écht een stap verder. Je denkt mee, stelt vragen en geeft een weerwoord als je een andere mening of ervaring hebt.
We zijn open en eerlijk naar elkaar en naar onze klanten. Samen gaan we voor het beste resultaat. Van jou verwachten we:

Teamspirit


Lef


Enthousiasme


Doorzettingsvermogen


En als je onze humor kan waarderen is dat een pré.

Ooit zitten we in New-York en hebben we tevreden klanten overal ter wereld. Jij begrijpt waar we naar toe willen en je groeit met ons mee. Dat kan alleen als jij je vrij voelt om het beste uit jezelf te halen en niet bang bent om in het diepe te springen. Spannend? Soms. Maar je weet dat er een heel team achter je staat. Met eerlijk advies en feedback maar ook met geintjes, goede koffie en een borrel op vrijdagmiddag.
Jij hebt
Ons motto? Automate everything. Ook binnen BI. Als blogs zoals Hoe Automated Deployment werkt binnen Business Intelligence en Waarom het Golden Path van IT en de Business is je aanspreken, nodigen we je en dagen we je uit om hierover met ons in gesprek te gaan!

Een afgeronde opleiding binnen IT uiteraard en een aantal jaar werkervaring als BI Consultant of Data Engineer. Belangrijker vinden we je ervaring met tooling en je drive om professioneel te puzzelen
Een hoog verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel binnen de ontwikkeling en het onderhoud van het Azure BI & Analytics platform


Kennis van software ontwikkeling in Microsoft SQL Server, Power BI, data modellering, ETL en Azure is een must
Kennis van Big Data platformen, uitgebreide kennis van DevOps en CI/CD


Het helpt als je een Scrum Master certificaat hebt


Je communicatie skills en je organiserend vermogen zijn onontbeerlijk in een jong en dynamisch bedrijf


Onze klanten werken vaak met internationale teams en zijn gewend om veelal in het Engels te communiceren.

Bij TeamValue en onze opdrachtgevers is de voertaal Nederlands. Uiteraard spreken we ook voldoende Engels gezien ons vakgebied. Het is wenselijk dat je beide talen beheerst.
Wat voegen wij toe?
Misschien zijn we een andere werkgever dan jij gewend bent. We werken vanuit vertrouwen. Jij weet waar je goed in bent en als je iets wil leren dan zijn we er om je dat te bieden.
Natuurlijk krijg je bij ons een passend salaris en een uitdagende baan. Je hoeft je geen moment te vervelen. Als je bij TeamValue werkt dan word jij onderdeel van ons team en dat betekent dat je altijd op ons kan rekenen. Je krijgt coaching, feedback en ook veel gezelligheid, want wij houden van borrelen, af en toe samen op stap en samen sporten. Er is meer in het leven dan alleen werk.
Wat bieden wij nog meer?

Uitdagende opdrachten en als consultant echt samenwerken met collega's aan projecten


Werken voor grote namen, zoals onder andere Allego, Humanitas, KPMG, ING, AkzoNobel, RDW en Microsoft
Een Golden Path – de bewezen gouden combinatie waarin de digitale transformatie altijd vergezeld gaat met de business change


Een salaris tussen de 3.000,- en 6000,- euro per maand en een pensioenbijdrage


2% extra vakantiegeld dan normaal omdat wij gaan voor die 10! en 26 vakantiedagen
Jaarlijkse Ohana BBQ incl. family en kerstdiner met partners


Met het team naar toffe events om onze kennis op peil te houden en nieuwe kennis op te doen


Een divers team met Business Intelligence Consultants, Azure Solution Developers, Architects en Agile coaches

Lees ook de verhalen van onze collega's: 

Hoe Automated Deployment werkt binnen Business Intelligence
Eerste stap richting een modern datawarehouse: Power BI Dataflows

* Recruitment agencies, hold your horses. We make sure to grow out the unicorn zone on our own. 
Soort dienstverband: Voltijds, Deeltijds, Vaste baan
Salaris: €3.000,00 - €6.000,00 per maand

ma-vr

Role Purpose:
 The purpose of this position is to ensure the performance, integrity and security of medium to high complexity databases and processes, contributing to the design of both back-end organisation of data and front-end accessibility for end-users. In addition, managing the governance, access and control of external client data adhering to the General Data Protection Regulations within a global environment.


 Key Responsibilities:
 Database Architecture

Manages and maintains the database architecture.
Monitors the health of the entire database system from database design to system architecture
Reviews and recommends changes to improve performance and service delivery across all aspects of the data environment
Monitors process and job efficiencies and effectiveness daily.
Clearly documents all database and related job information for each database, including data standards, procedures and definitions.
Monitors production databases regularly or respond to any database issues.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and cloud technologies.
Implement processes using API’s to import external system data that is relevant to stakeholder reporting requirements.
Manage existing API’s, ensuring they operate optimally.



 Utilities and Reporting

Assists with the development of database utilities and automated reporting.
Implements accurate and effective means to monitor system performance and process run times.
Enables data analytics team to access data concurrently in a way or form that suits their particular needs and improves delivery efficiencies.
Create data tools for analytics team members that assist them in building and optimizing our products.



 Data Security

Maintains data standards in accordance with business requirements, the company policies, and the data protection legislation.
Works in accordance with the security information requirements and procedures of the company.
Controls access to databases environments through permissions and privileges.



 Stakeholder Management

Clearly and effectively communicate with relevant stakeholders around issue resolution and escalation management
Document all processes relating to data extraction/update/transformation and store in the online library for update and review annually.
Work within a team to drive and deliver solutions that meet the needs of the business, contributing to the overall success and goals of the business
Regularly upskill through internal and external training resources to stay abreast of best practices



 Competencies

Proficiency with relational SQL and MySQL database.
Proficiency with SQL Server.
Experience in Informix would be advantageous.
Proficiency with SSMS, SSIS, SSRS, SSDT
Proficiency with cloud services: Azure, Snowflake, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.

job_title: Project Engineer – Network and data communication
job_description:
At Hitachi Energy our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation
Do you want to energize your career by working in challenging customer projects with advanced power and electrical control systems? Hitachi Energy, Grid and Power Quality Solutions (GPQS) unit (former FACTS – Flexible AC Transmission Systems) in Västerås, currently has several vacancies for Station Operation and Monitoring Engineers within our Global Center of Competence / Control Engineering department. If you have the necessary drive and results focus, Hitachi Energy, GPQS offers a stimulating and dynamic environment in a global context where you will be working at the forefront of the energy industry. We offer you a role where you can grow in various ways: technically and in terms of visibility and leadership. We are looking for a driven, teamwork-oriented achiever for this position. We would welcome applications from experienced professionals, as well as younger applicants who are keen to take their carriers to the next level. To excel in this position, you need to be organized, responsive and solution-driven, with a strong focus on delivering results and serving the customer.
Your responsibilities

As Station Operation and Monitoring Engineer with focus area on Network and data communication, you will work with high quality deliveries and cost-efficient engineering solutions for our customers.
In close collaboration with our Control Application engineers and other colleagues you will take responsibility for design of network topology, configuration of network devices and verification of network communication related to our MACHTM control system controlling the PQS Application.
You will hold a frequent contact with other engineering groups, project managers, local Hitachi Energy offices and our customers to achieve the best results.

Your background

You have an engineering related degree, ideally with a specialization in data communication and network technology. Similar training can also be considered.
You have preferably some years of experience from similar engineering positions working with process- or substation automation and network communication.
Relevant experience in some of the following areas will be considered meritorious:
Windows and Active Directory administration
Network administration and network security
Hands on experience using Linux
Configuration and troubleshooting of firewalls, network switches, File Transfer, data diodes and other network devices
Knowledge of commonly used Layer2 & 3 switching protocols
Experience in troubleshooting TCP/IP network
Commonly used Protocols like LDAP, SMB, SFTP, HTTP, SSL etc.
Network Time Protocol
Syslog/SNMP
Backup and restore devices and software configuration
Experience of Hitachi Energy Control system, MACHTM is considered a strong plus.
This position involves a great deal of customer contacts and close cooperation with colleagues worldwide; therefore, English is required, both verbally and written; Swedish is considered as an additional plus.

More about us
Are you ready for an exciting new challenge? Does the above description sound like you? We are interested in learning more about you and what you can contribute with, so do not hesitate to apply even if you do not meet all requirements. Welcome to apply before February 7th, 2023! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today! Recruiting manager Anitha Shanmugasundaram, anitha.s@hitachienergy.com, will be happy to answer your questions regarding this position. More information: Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer; Stefan Andersson, +46 107- 38 08 21; Ledarna: Christer Fridlund, +46 107-38 29 12; Unionen: Karin Ulvemark, +46 107-38 51 42 or Ingrid Rinaldo, +46 107- 38 58 19. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Helena Stefansdottir, helena.stefansdottir@hitachienergy.com Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader that is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We serve customers in the utility, industry and infrastructure sectors with innovative solutions and services across the value chain. Together with customers and partners, we pioneer technologies and enable the digital transformation required to accelerate the energy transition towards a carbon-neutral future. We are advancing the world’s energy system to become more sustainable, flexible and secure whilst balancing social, environmental and economic value. Hitachi Energy has a proven track record and unparalleled installed base in more than 140 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ around 40,000 people in 90 countries and generate business volumes of approximately $10 billion USD. www.hitachienergy.com #LI-NEU1

Your Title: Trainee, Data Analyst / Engineer
   Job Location: Espoo (Leppävaara), Finland
   Our Department: 
  
   Structures
  



 Would you like to work in a truly international and diverse working environment with meaningful and interesting tasks in the modern software industry? This will be an excellent opportunity to gain valuable work experience and develop your skills with the help of great mentors. Our welcoming culture is a safe space where you can be yourself and achieve your potential.


 We are now looking for a Trainee, Data Analyst / Engineer to join our Customer Insights, Data and Analytics team at Trimble in Espoo. We hope you will be able to start in May and work until the end of August.
 

 What You Will Do
 


   You will join a team responsible for generating data driven customer insights and driving data driven culture, processes and tools within Trimble’s Structures Division. You will work alongside data analysts, data engineers and data scientists focusing on a variety of different types of data.
 


   We are proud of enabling our organization to improve our products, services and customers’ experience through the analytics and insights we provide. We hope you share our passion for data and are eager to learn and grow as part of the team.
 


   Depending on your background and skills your tasks will include supporting and/or coordinating various projects related to data analysis, data engineering, data management and governance.
 

 What Skills You Could Bring
 

 You are curious by nature. You are also a proactive team player that likes to get things done
 You are in your Master level studies with a focus on analytics, business intelligence, data science or computer sciences
 You have fluent written and spoken English and strong communication and collaboration skills
 We consider it as a plus if you are interested in/have previous experience in web analytics and have experience in programming languages like SQL, Python etc.


 Join our team! Apply via the application form as soon as possible, by February 5 at the latest.
 

 About Your Location
 

   You will be based in our brand new office in Espoo. It is only a 5 min walk from Leppävaara train station to our office. We have flexible working hours and a hybrid working model.
 


   About Our Structures Division
   We are proud of developing Tekla software solutions for structural engineering that are driving the BIM revolution. We are committed to improving digital construction information workflows to give our customers a competitive edge. Visit 
  
   https://www.tekla.com/references
   or watch our BIM awards 2022 video (
  
   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZpfQChQ_wuQ
   ) to get an idea of what we help to build all over the world. More information about us on 
  
   https://www.tekla.com/
  


 About Trimble
 

   Trimble is an industrial technology company transforming the way the world works by delivering solutions that enable our customers to thrive. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics connect the digital and physical worlds to improve productivity, quality, safety, transparency and sustainability. From purpose built products to enterprise lifecycle solutions, Trimble is transforming industries such as agriculture, construction, geospatial and transportation.
  

   www.trimble.com
  


 Videos:
 



     Trimble - Life´s work
    ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kbuoxq5S_M4 )


     Life at Trimble, Sakari
    (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Jy_NfsNDio&t=1s )


 Trimble’s Inclusiveness Commitment
   We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while also moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work.
 

   We have programs in place to make sure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly that they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from.

Role Overview 
Provide direct technical web and telephone support to Fortinet customers. 


Responsibilities: 


Troubleshooting on the full range of Fortinet products. 
Collection, analysis and change recommendations of configuration information. 
Collection and analysis of customer network information. 
Collection and initial analysis of packet trace information. 
Recommend corrective actions based on analysis. 
Provide customer education where it is needed due to gaps in networking, product knowledge, etc. 
Consultation of technical documentation, bulletins and release notes for known problems. 
Reproduction of customer environments on lab equipment. 
Follow up on technical cases including proper escalation and management of the case until case closure. 
Manage customer communications and expectations until the closure of each case. 




Requirements: 


At least 5 years of experience in a technical support role in a networking/security company or equivalent education. 
Strong understanding of SIEM, TCP/IP, routing protocols, L2/L3 switches 
Experience with security products firewalls, IPSec, IDS/IPS, Anti Spam, virus scanning. 
Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills. 
Extensive working knowledge of Windows, UNIX or Linux. 
Previous call center experience, preferably supporting data networking products and/or security products is desirable. 
Strong English skills both written and verbal. 
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field, or an equivalent combination of training and experience is desirable. 


 Fortinet is an equal opportunity employer.  We will only notify shortlisted candidates.  Fortinet will not entertain any unsolicited resumes, please refrain from sending them to any Fortinet employees or Fortinet email aliases.

JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally. 

 Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally. 

 What this job involves 
Support project teams in delivering real estate consulting assignments across the MEA region 

 Centralize, organize and manage data for the team 

 Analyse data from JLL databases and create a centralized database for all data points 

 Develop processes and tools to streamline and monitor data collection / storage / and standardization 

 Visualize data for stakeholders using Tableau and Power BI 

 Create and update databases, GIS maps and associated dashboards 

 Develop market analyses tools using AI and automation (e.g. Power BI) 

 Produce advanced analytics results including correlation, predictive and testing results 

 Assist with the development of periodic reports, slide decks and research papers. 

 This job can accommodate for remote working. 

 Desired skills and experience for this job 

 Education and experience 
You should ideally have a Degree in Computer Science, Computer engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics. You should have a previous consolidated professional experience in Business Intelligence projects and Big Data projects as Data Analyst for at least 3 years. An excellent working knowledge of English is an essential prerequisite (both written and verbal). Any additional language would be a plus and previous financial / real estate experience is desirable. 

 Technical competencies 
We will expect you to have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze data and information with attention to detail and accuracy, communication aptitude (written and verbal), data management capabilities, as well as an excellent knowledge of all the computer tools: Microsoft excel, power point, word, outlook, PPT productivity tools, Power BI, Tableau, Thinkcell and ArcGIS. Knowledge of R and Python would be a plus. 

 LI-AB1 
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table! 

 Personalized benefits that support personal well-being and growth: 

 JLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health. 

 About JLL – 

 We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities. 

 Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally. 

 Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.

We are now looking for a Data Engineer to join Data, Analytics & BI and our Central Tech & Services (CTS) department.
 The Data, Analytics & BI teams work closely together to provide Paradox’s various game studios and publishing teams with insights and data. As a data engineer you will join the data platform team who is responsible of developing and maintaining scalable data flows of both internal and external data into our central data warehouse Snowflake.
 You will work closely with developers, data scientists, digital analysts and BI specialists in order to deliver on end-to-end data solutions for Paradox.
 What you will be doing

Experience with both python and NodeJS


We believe you are a service-minded, driven and curious individual, comfortable with solving problems and working autonomously within a group.  Some of our benefits include:

 At Paradox Interactive we celebrate difference and care deeply about diversity and inclusion. We therefore encourage you, no matter who you are, to apply for this job if you think you’d be a great addition to our team.

 Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve.
